question: As a creator, how do NFT’s play a role in engaging my community?
answer:
Think of NFT’s as a membership card for your loyal followers (those that buy your NFT).

Although you want to share your recipe to the world, maybe there are things that you only want to share with those that are truly passionate about your story.

Exclusive content can be anything you can think of! Create videos of a special cooking technique, share information about a rare ingredient, or maybe host a talk with your key followers to see if you guys can become pass

question: What is a creator ribbon?
answer:
A creator ribbon is essentially a membership for creators..

We use blockchain technology to create a unique NFT that will entitle holders to creator events, access to future partners, and the ability to have a say in the future direction of Prove.

question: As a foodie, why do I need to buy an NFT to interact with the creator?
answer:
We believe recipes should be shared with everyone. So you don’t have to buy an NFT to view recipes.

Rather, buying a pantry item NFT is like buying a membership to support the creator. 

Perhaps you want to learn secret cooking techniques? Or be able to talk creators at hosted events? Or maybe you want them to turn their recipe into a real-life product which you can redeem with your NFT? 

The possibilities are endless!

question: Why use NFT’s?
answer:
Although NFT’s haven’t always been in the news for good reasons, we believe that they have some amazing use cases.

By purchasing the pantry item NFT, you will enable the creator to build more engaging content, or even turn their idea into a real-life product (with Prove’s help).

Or, if you don’t feel like the content resonates with you, you can sell it on an NFT marketplace like OpenSea.

Lastly, if you want to use other web3 services, you can use this NFT as proof of your previous activity. That way, when using a new service, you don’t have to create a profile from scratch again!

question: What does becoming a key stakeholder in Prove projects mean?
What are Prove’s future plans?
answer:
Pantry item competitions

Physical space to sell pantry items

IRL merch for global users
